trans-unit.source: A secure and interoperable binding that supports federated security.
Federation is the ability to share identities across multiple systems for authentication and authorization.
These identities can refer to users or to machines.
Federated HTTP supports SOAP security as well as mixed-mode security, but it does not support exclusively using transport security.
This binding provides [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] support for the WS-Federation protocol.
Services configured with this binding must use the HTTP transport.
Bindings consist of a stack of binding elements.

The stack of binding elements in <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding> is the same as that contained in <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> when <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.Security%2A> is set to the default value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.Message>.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding> controls the details of the message security settings, the values of which are available from the instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.FederatedMessageSecurityOverHttp> that is returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurity.Message%2A> property.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding> also provides a <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding.PrivacyNoticeAt%2A> property to set and retrieve the URI at which the privacy notice is located.

When calling a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service built with [!INCLUDE[netfx40_short](~/includes/netfx40-short-md.md)] from a WCF client application built with [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] or earlier, the configuration file generated by svcutil.exe or adding a service reference from [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] contains the `establishSecurityContext` attribute in the binding configuration.

This attribute is not recognized by the [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] runtime and the application throws an <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException> with the message "Unrecognized attribute establishSecurityContext ".
To workaround this problem, remove the `establishSecurityContext` attribute from the binding configuration.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding"></xref> class.

The details of these settings are available from the instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.FederatedMessageSecurityOverHttp> that is returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurity.Message%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding"></xref> class with a specified type of security used by the binding.

The default value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode> is <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.Message> which specifies that integrity, confidentiality, and server and client authentication are provided using SOAP message security.

The details of these settings are available from the instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.FederatedMessageSecurityOverHttp> that is returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurity.Message%2A> property.
The value of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode"></xref> that specifies the type of security that is used with the SOAP message and for the client.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding"></xref> class with a binding specified by its configuration name.
The binding configuration name for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WSHttpBindingElement"></xref>.
The binding element with the name configurationName was not found.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding"></xref> class with a specified type of security used by the binding and a value that indicates whether a reliable session is enabled.
The value of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode"></xref> that specifies the type of security that is used with the SOAP message and for the client.
`true` if a reliable session is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a collection with the binding elements for the binding.
The stack of binding elements depends on the value of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode> set.

The stack of binding elements in <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding> is the same as that contained in <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> when <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.Security%2A> is set to the default value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.Message>.

However, setting <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode> to <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.TransportWithMessageCredential> results in a stack that is something of a hybrid between the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding> bindings.
Finally, using the MTOM encoder looks exactly the same as for <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding>.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement"></xref> that makes up the binding.
Creates a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement"></xref> that has enabled a reliable session.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement"></xref> that has enabled a reliable session.
Returns the transport binding element from the current binding.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransportBindingElement"></xref> from the current binding.
Gets or sets the URI at which the privacy notice is located.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> at which the privacy notice is located.
Gets or sets the privacy notice version number for the binding.
The version number of the privacy notice.
Gets or sets the type of security used with this binding.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurity"></xref> that specifies the mode of security used with this binding.
The default value of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode"></xref> for this binding is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.Message"></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding.Security"></xref> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
`true` if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding.Security"></xref> property value should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
